body_html: @drasmuss Unfortunately I don't see how to restrict dynamic_stitch without sacrificing performance. We're also bound by backwards compatibility to keep the current spec, which explicitly allows duplicates and says how they're deduped.
body_text: @drasmuss Unfortunately I don't see how to restrict dynamic_stitch without sacrificing performance.  We're also bound by backwards compatibility to keep the current spec, which explicitly allows duplicates and says how they're deduped.
body: @drasmuss Unfortunately I don't see how to restrict dynamic_stitch without sacrificing performance.  We're also bound by backwards compatibility to keep the current spec, which explicitly allows duplicates and says how they're deduped.
